richardsde

Class Picture

  • java.lang.Object
    • richardsde.Picture

  • public class Picture
extends java.lang.Object
    A class representing a picture

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Picture(java.util.List<Dot> emptyList)
      A constructor that sets that initializes the dotList to reference an empty list.
      Picture(Picture original, java.util.List<Dot> emptyList)
      A constructor that copies the dots from another Picture object into an empty List and uses it to store the dots for the current Picture object.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void drawDots(javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas canvas)
      Tries to draw the current picture with only dots.
      void drawLines(javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas canvas)
      Tries to recreate the original drawing without any dots.
      void load(java.nio.file.Path path)
      Method used to create the image on the canvas
      void removeDots(int numberDesired, java.lang.String strategy)
      Has the user input the amount of dots to keep and removes dots from the image so that the image has that amount of dots.
      void save(java.nio.file.Path path)
      Tries to write in the x and y coordinates of the dots in the image.
      void setCanvas(javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas canvas)

        emptyList - An empty List of Dot objects.

    • Method Detail

      • load

        public void load(java.nio.file.Path path)
          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Method used to create the image on the canvas
        Parameters:
        path - The filepath used to find the information for the dots.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the file type is one other than ".dot"

      • save

        public void save(java.nio.file.Path path)
        Tries to write in the x and y coordinates of the dots in the image.
        Parameters:
        path - The file path of the image.

      • drawDots

        public void drawDots(javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas canvas)
        Tries to draw the current picture with only dots.
        Parameters:
        canvas - The canvas where the image is being displayed.

      • drawLines

        public void drawLines(javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas canvas)
        Tries to recreate the original drawing without any dots.
        Parameters:
        canvas - The canvas where the image is being displayed.

      • removeDots

        public void removeDots(int numberDesired,
                       java.lang.String strategy)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                       java.util.InputMismatchException
        Has the user input the amount of dots to keep and removes dots from the image so that the image has that amount of dots.
        Parameters:
        numberDesired - The number of dots to keep.
        strategy - A string containing the strategy used to remove dots from the picture: using indices or using an iterator.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the number of dots to keep is a number less than three.
        java.util.InputMismatchException - If the strategy entered is not one of the two supported strategies.

      • setCanvas

        public void setCanvas(javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas canvas)
